docs.lead_paragraph: The Greenpoint Food Market has shut down at least until the fall, said Joann Kim, the market's organizer. The market, briefly, was a venue for small-scale food artisans to try out products like artisanal sodas, Indian-Mexican tacos, and organic butter flavored with foraged ramps.

headline.main: Greenpoint Food Market Isn't Reopening Until at Least September

docs.abstract: Organizers found that it was too expensive for vendors to meet health department requirements.

docs.lead_paragraph: After soldiers return to the United States from Iraq, the odds that some of them will die violent deaths continues. The military has shifted some focus to the home front.

docs.lead_paragraph: My first assignment as a Yankees beat reporter in the mid-1980s was to cover spring training at the team's former home in Fort Lauderdale. I received a press credential in the mail, but if I wanted a parking pass I had to meet withGeorge Steinbrenner. A dozen years after buying the franchise and several years after resurrecting it with two World Series championships, Steinbrenner was personally in charge of the 75 spring training parking spots.

headline.main: THE BOSS; The Parking Pass Interview

docs.abstract: New York Yankees owner George Steinbrenner, who has made many questionable and controversial moves over the course of his career, will be remebered by many for his unmatched generosity; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical industry's Washington trade group has selected another powerhouse as its new president: John J. Castellani, who spent nine years as president of the Business Roundtable, which represents the chief executives of companies that together have $5 trillion in annual revenues.

headline.main: New Chief Named for Pharmaceutical Lobby

docs.abstract: John J. Castellani replaces Billy Tauzin as head of the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America trade group.
docs.snippet: John J. Castellani replaces Billy Tauzin as head of the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America trade group.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks in the three major indexes extended their gains for a fifth consecutive session on Monday, edging up in thin volume ahead of the onslaught of corporate reports that started with Alcoa.

headline.main: Wall St. Manages to Keep Its Winning Streak Alive

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday rejected Citigroup's bid to dismiss a class-action lawsuit by bondholders who said the bank misled them about its exposure to troubled mortgages, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Judge Rules Bondholders Can Pursue Citigroup Suit
